timeline.title: Bates College
timeline.subtitle: Matriculated!
timeline.description: Moved from the sleepy suburbs of Boston to the sleepy town of Lewiston, ME for my undergraduate education. Recruited to row, and ended up playing Ultimate Frisbee instead.

timeline.title: Bates College
timeline.subtitle: Bachelor of Science, Mathematics and Physics
timeline.description: Earned my undergraduate degree, dabbling in computer science as a hobbyist. Wrote a mathematics thesis titled Convolution and Neural Networks under the advisory of Prof. Katharine Ott. Nominated as a result to the Sigma Xi Research Honor Society.

timeline.title: Carney, Sandoe, & Associates
timeline.subtitle: Hired! Technology Associate
timeline.description: My first post-grad job. A small 30-person company, with an even smaller 3-person technology team, meant that I wore a lot of hats. From fixing employees print drivers, to implementing new web services to facilitate API interactions.

timeline.title: Northeastern University
timeline.subtitle: Matriculated (again)!
timeline.description: It was time to formalize my credentials with a Masters in Computer Science. And I wasn't quite ready to leave my job.

timeline.title: Northeastern University
timeline.subtitle: Full time student again!
timeline.description: Left CS&A to persue my masters full time.
